foliage:
叶子 
the leaves of a plant or of many plants
crumble:
破碎，粉碎 
to break (something) into small pieces

崩溃 
to break down completely

弄皱 
to become wrinkled or bent; to stop being smooth or flat

因为受伤，失去知觉，喝醉而突然瘫倒，跌倒 
to suddenly bend and fall
involuntary:
不由自主的 
not done or made consciously

非自愿的，强迫的 
not done by choice 
187
blemish:
斑点；疤痕；瑕疵 
a mark on the skin or on an object that spoils it and makes it look less beautiful or perfect

破坏…的完美；玷污 
to spoil something that is beautiful or perfect in all other ways
unfathomable:
事物高深莫测的，深奥的 
impossible to understand
anatomy:
解剖学； 动植物的结构，解剖 
the scientific study of the structure of human or animal bodies; the structure of an animal or 
a plant

剖析；解析 
an examination of what something is like, the way it works or why it happens
metamorphose:
变形，蜕变 
to change in an important and obvious way into something that is very different; to undergo metamorphosis
steadfast:
坚定的 
very devoted or loyal to a person, belief, or cause; not changing
apathetic:
冷漠的 
not having or showing much emotion or interest
be_liable_to:
易受…之害的 ;有法律责任的 
susceptible; have legal responsibility
pragmatic:
务实的，实用主义的 
dealing with the problems that exist in a specific situation in a reasonable and logical way 
instead of depending on ideas and theories
ruminate:
反刍 
to bring up and chew again what has already been chewed and swallowed

深思 
to think carefully and deeply about something
heresy:
异端邪说 
a belief or opinion that does not agree with the official belief or opinion of a particular religion
seam:
缝合 
to join by sewing 
188
diabetes:
糖尿病 
a serious disease in which the body cannot properly control the amount of sugar in your 
blood because it does not have enough insulin
denude:
使裸露；剥夺，夺去；使光秃 
to strip (something) of its covering, possessions, or assets; make bare
remnant:
剩余物 
the part of something that is left when the other parts are gone
drudgery:
苦差 
boring, difficult, or unpleasant work
urbane:
温文尔雅的 
polite and confident
medley:
混杂物；混合物；混杂的人群 
a varied mixture of people or things; a miscellany
shred:
碎片，细条 
a long, thin piece cut or torn off of something

撕碎，切碎 
to cut or tear (something) into long, thin pieces
disclaim:
否认 
to say that you do not have (something, such as knowledge, responsibility, etc.)
segregate:
隔离 
to separate groups of people because of their particular race, religion, etc.
stationary:
静止的，固定的 
not moving; staying in one place or position
militant:
好战的 
having or showing a desire or willingness to use strong, extreme, and sometimes forceful 
methods to achieve something 
189
expedite:
加快 
to cause (something) to happen faster
deft:
敏捷熟练的 
able to do something quickly and accurately
dilapidated:
残破的，破烂的 
in very bad condition because of age or lack of care
contempt:
轻视，蔑视 
a feeling that someone or something is not worthy of any respect or approval
chauvinism:
沙文主义；本国至上主义 
an aggressive and unreasonable belief that your own country is better than all others
garment:
衣服 
a piece of clothing
propriety:
适当；正当；妥当；得体 
behavior that is accepted as socially or morally correct and proper
warrant:
搜查令；令状 
a document issued by a court that gives the police the power to do something

保证，担保 
to officially affirm or guarantee

使显得必要或正当 
to justify or necessitate (a certain course of action)
contemplate:
沉思 
to think deeply or carefully about (something)
stitch:
缝；绣；缝补 
to sew something; to use a needle and thread to mend, join, or decorate pieces of fabric
meticulous:
一丝不苟的 
very careful about doing something in an extremely accurate and exact way
threshold:
门槛 
a piece of wood, metal, or stone that forms the bottom of a door and that you walk over as 
you enter a room or building
harbinger:
预示 
something that shows what is coming 
190
deprive:
剥夺 
to take something away from someone or something; to not allow (someone or something) 
to have or keep (something)
tactical:
战术上的；策略上的 
connected with the particular method you use to achieve something

有谋略的；手段高明的；善于谋划的 
carefully planned in order to achieve a particular aim
grieve:
对…感到悲痛 
to feel or show grief or sadness
secrete:
分泌 
to produce and give off (a liquid)

藏匿 
to put (something) in a hidden place
anticipatory:
期待中的，期望的 
characterized by anticipation; anticipating
slum:
贫民窟 
an area of a city where poor people live and the buildings are in bad condition

逛贫民窟；体验下层社会的生活 
to spend time in places or conditions that are much worse than your usual places or conditions
mirage:
幻景；海市蜃楼 
an effect caused by hot air in deserts or on roads, that makes you think you can see 
something, such as water, which is not there

幻想；妄想 
a hope or wish that you cannot make happen because it is not realistic
territorial:
土地的，领地的 
relating to or occurring on the earth
dogged:
顽强的；坚持不懈的 
showing determination; not giving up easily
wispy:
一缕缕的；成束的；纤细的 
consisting of small, thin pieces; not thick
twirl:
旋转 
to turn or spin around and around
wondrous:
惊奇的 
causing wonder or amazement; very beautiful or impressive 
191
momentous:
重大的 
very important; having great or lasting importance
lease:
租用，租借，出租 尤指房地产或设备 
to use or let somebody use something, especially property or equipment, in exchange for 
rent or a regular payment

房屋、设备或土地的租约，租契 
a legal agreement that allows you to use a building, a piece of equipment or some land for a 
period of time, usually in return for rent
monotonous:
单调的 
used to describe something that is boring because it is always the same
jury:
陪审团 
a group of people who are members of the public and are chosen to make a decision in a 
legal case
shed_light_on:
为 提供线索，使 清楚地显示出，阐明 
to make free from confusion or ambiguity; to make clear
bombard:
连续轰炸 
to attack (a place) with bombs, large guns, etc.

连珠炮似地提问；不断批评 
to hit or attack (something or someone) constantly or repeatedly
privation:
贫困；匮乏；艰难 
a lack of the basic things that people need for living
postulate:
假定，假设 
a statement that is accepted as being true and that is used as the basis of a theory, argument, 
etc.

假设，推断 
to assume or claim as true, existent, or necessary
unutterable:
尤指不好的事情无以名状的，难以形容的 
too strong or great to be expressed or described
orator:
演说者；雄辩家；演讲者 
a public speaker, especially one who is eloquent or skilled
fiery:
激情四射的 
having or showing a lot of strong and angry emotion

燃烧般的，炽烈的 
having or producing fire 
192
itinerary:
行程；旅行日程 
a plan of a journey, including the route and the places that you visit
literacy:
读写能力 
the ability to read and write
cuddle:
拥抱；搂抱 
to hold (someone or something) in your arms in order to show affection
longevity:
长寿 
long life; the fact of living for many years
sinister:
不祥的；险恶的 
having an evil appearance; looking likely to cause somerhing bad, harmful, or dangerous to happen
dignitary:
显要人物 
a person who has a high rank or an important position
phobia:
恐惧症 
an extremely strong dislike or fear of someone or something
meltdown:
核反应堆的堆芯熔毁 
an accident in which the core of a nuclear reactor melts and releases radiation

崩溃，彻底失败 
a very fast collapse or failure
convene:
召集会议 ；召开 
to come together in a group for a meeting
incubator:
体弱或早产婴儿恒温箱 
a piece of equipment in a hospital which new babies are placed in when they are weak or 
born too early, in order to help them survive

孵化器 
a machine like a box where eggs are kept warm until the young birds are born
instantaneous:
瞬间的 
happening very quickly; happening in an instant 
193
stale:
无趣的 
not interesting or new; boring or unoriginal

食物 不新鲜的 
(of food) no longer good or appealing; no longer fresh
expel:
把…开除 或除名 
to officially make somebody leave a school or an organization

驱逐出境 
to force somebody to leave a country

排出；喷出 
to force air or water out of a part of the body or from a container 
194
procrastinate:
拖延 
to delay or postpone action; put off doing something
beckon:
召唤 
to signal (someone) with your arm or hand in order to tell that person to come closer or follow

吸引 
to appear attractive or inviting
undue:
过分的 
more than is reasonable or necessary; excessive
rebound:
弹回；反弹 
to bounce back after hitting something

对…产生反作用，对…产生不良影响尤指本欲使其发生在别人身上 
(of an event or situation) have an unexpected adverse consequence for (someone, especially 
the person responsible for it)
bulk:
主体，大部分 
most of something; the largest part of something

大 体积， 大 量 
the large size of someone or something
